definitions.definition: (stative) To perceive sounds through the ear.
definitions.example: I was deaf, and now I can hear.

definitions.definition: (stative) To perceive (a sound, or something producing a sound) with the ear, to recognize (something) in an auditory way.
definitions.example: I heard a sound from outside the window.

definitions.definition: To exercise this faculty intentionally; to listen to.
To listen favourably to; to grant (a request etc.).
definitions.example: Eventually the king chose to hear her entreaties.

definitions.definition: To receive information about; to come to learn of.
To listen to (a person, case) in a court of law; to try.
definitions.example: Your case will be heard at the end of the month.

definitions.definition: To sympathize with; to understand the feelings or opinion of.
definitions.example: You're tired of all the ads on TV? I hear ya.

definitions.definition: The sense used to perceive sound.
definitions.example: My hearing isn't what it used to be, but I still heard that noise.

definitions.definition: The act by which something is heard.
A proceeding at which discussions are heard.
definitions.example: There will be a public hearing to discuss the new traffic light.

definitions.definition: A legal procedure done before a judge, without a jury, as with an evidentiary hearing.

definitions.example: Deaf people often must deal with hearing people.
